message: You can't enter Feygard yet.
No entry.
No entry. Go away.
I don't want to hear anything.
You were dealing with those weirdly dressed weirdos back there. I've been watching you.
I chased them away from the wall yesterday. They were doing something very suspicious there.
And what did it get me? A night in arrest and next 3 days of peeling potatoes.
I had left my post - they said.
Of course. Yet I was supposed to guard the gate - they said.
And that's exactly what I'm going to do now: guard the gate. Nothing else.
Go away.
No entry. Go away.
Oh dear. My head.
Don't scream like that. Oh, oh, oh.
The tenth mead last night must have been bad.
No entry. Go away.
Can't you see we are busy?
Yes. Come again tomorrow. Or the day after.
Where were we? Oh yes... when the Mead ran out in the pub, things got loud.
You probably weren't innocent of the mead shortage.
Well ... Hey, kid! Don't stand here and waste our time. Get lost!
No entry. Go away.
No entry. Go away.
No entry. Go away.
Child - explain yourself! What do you want here at the gates of Feygard?

replies.text: I heard the guard on the wall on the other side of the gate talking about you. It was interesting, but not particularly pleasant.

message: So? Keep talking.

replies.text: I don't want to spread rumors. If I were you, I'd confront him directly.

message: What a nerve! I'll pay him a visit immediately.

replies.text: Don't! That would only make him look better.

message: Hmm. What do you suggest?

replies.text: Summon him and put him down here. Preferably in a way that all the other guards can hear.

message: I'll do that immediately. That rascal will regret his words!
Take back your words!
You liar!
You gossiping knave!
You snake!
You rotter!
Well, aren’t you a loyal friend.
That was rather two-faced of you.
You hypocrite!
What a fine friend you are.
Go away.
The ogre grabs you with his left hand and throws you high into the air.
Luckily, a haystack slows your impact.
... and now we've come this far just to fail at these ridiculous walls?
We tried. Time was just enough to place the markings, then the Feygard guards came and chased us away from the wall.
Cursed be those pesky guards.
And yet we look so harmless and peaceful.
We need a foolish helper. But where do we get one?
Hush ... someone is listening ...
Look who's coming ...

replies.text: Hello. What are you supposed to be?
Do you know how I could get into the city?

message: Ohh, brothers, our prayers have been answered!
Which praye ... Ouch, why are you kicking me ... oh, right: Our prayers have been answered.
We traveled a long way to honor the eternal Elythara.
Yes, exactly.
And now they deny us entry to the city. They say we are not properly dressed!
And above all, we don't have enough gold to bribe the guards.
My brother meant we don't have enough gold to make a great sacrifice for Elythara.

replies.text: Gold can be of help sometimes. What will you do now?

message: We'll take the new entrance. Elythara herself showed us in a vision how we can reach her.
Really? How ... Ouch!
Do you see the little flowers in front of the city walls back there?
A gate will appear there if we perform the invocations correctly.
Exactly. Unfortunately, the guards are suspicious, probably because they fear us. They no longer allow us to go there.
That's why Elythara sent you to us. Will you help us?
You can also use the new gate yourself.

replies.text: Sure, I'll be glad to help.

message: So you want to help, great! I'll explain what you have to do:
At the flowers near to the wall, the tiny ones, you place one of these crystals each.
No, the torches first!
Nonsense. The torches block the passage. If the torches are placed first, you can't get in anymore.
But you can't get out either.
Exactly. First we must ...
SILENCE! I'll explain it.
So: First you place all but one crystal.
Then you place all the torches at the bigger plants and light them.
All - except one. That's important.
When all four crystals are placed, an ogre will appear.
Exactly. And he mustn't roam around freely. That's why the torches.
The torches block the way. So make sure to light the last torch from outside.
Otherwise ... hahaha ... you'll be trapped! Hahaha!
You don't want to be trapped with the ogre inside a circle of torches.

replies.text: But isn't the ogre trapped then?

message: Uh, yeah. [scratches his head]
Of course there will be no torch at the wall. That's where the ogre will go through.
Huh?
You hang a sign with 'EXIT' in big letters on the wall.
But there is no exit ...
Exactly - not yet! Clever child.
The ogre will smash the exit into the wall!
Oh, I see! Clever idea from you.
Clever idea from Elythara, you mean. [another ouch from the baker]
Do you understand it all?

replies.text: I think so. First I'll hang up the sign.

message: Good.

replies.text: Then I'll place the crystals and torches, leaving one of each until the end.

message: Good.

replies.text: Then the last crystal and finally the last torch. From outside.

message: From outside, yes. Otherwise no one can help you anymore.

replies.text: This will be exciting. Where do you have the items?

message: The baker has them in his pack. Baker, hand ye over the crystals and the torches!
Finally I don't have to carry them anymore.
Why did I have to carry them all the way anyway?
Because only you could bear the heavy burden of responsibility for them.
Ah, that's fine then. Hoho.
So here are the four crystals, the six torches, and most important: the sign.
And now do all that you know and try all that you don't.
Not a chance must be wasted today.
Oh, you useless kid! Closed the ring of torches without placing the crystals!
Do you want to undo all our efforts? You have to fix this!
Baker! Go and collect the torches again. This incompetent child needs to do it all again.
Very well! At least I carry out my duties responsibly. Take me as an example.
Hurry up, baker!
Now at last. Here are the torches again. Do better now!
Go and finish your work. We have hardly a minute to waste!
The Ogre hasn't done anything useful yet. It's all your fault.
Now there's a nice entrance, but the Ogre is watching it. Make him go away!
Why are the torches still burning and barring the way? It's all your fault.
The entrance is free now. We just have to wait for a good opportunity to go through - probably in the night.
The fence of torches is closed. I'm curious to see what the ogre will do.
[Shocked] The ogre has torn a huge hole in the wall!
And now the Ogre vanishes through that hole.
The Ogre must have gotten impatient and smashed the wall even without an Exit sign.
Hey, kid! Don't you dare to use the entrance before us!

replies.text: OK. What are you waiting for?

message: For the blessing of Elythara.
In one of the next releases! Hahaha!
Somehow it's like breaking the 5th wall.

replies.text: You are rather weired, you know.

message: Do you want to place an oger crystal here?

replies.text: I should put the sign on the wall first.

message: Do you want to place an oger crystal here?

replies.text: I should put the sign on the wall first.

message: Do you want to place an oger crystal here?

replies.text: I should put the sign on the wall first.

message: Do you want to place an oger crystal here?

replies.text: I should put the sign on the wall first.

message: It's better not to place anything suspicious while you are being watched by a guard.
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Do you want to place a bright shining torch next to you?
Here is a good place to put an exit sign on the wall.
Nice.
The noise of the rushing water starts again.
The loud noise of the rushing water decreases.
